meanings.definition: A group of soldiers organized for a specific purpose
meanings.sent1: The brigades marched in formation towards the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The military brigades trained together to improve their skills.
meanings.sent3: The brigades decided to have a race to see who could reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent4: The brigades of ants worked tirelessly to build their nest.
meanings.sent5: The image of the brigades standing in unity left a lasting impression on the spectators.

meanings.definition: A group of people working together for a common cause or goal
meanings.sent1: The volunteer brigades cleaned up the park every weekend.
meanings.sent2: The brigades of students collaborated on the project to ensure its success.
meanings.sent3: The brigades of chefs competed in a friendly cook-off to showcase their skills.
meanings.sent4: The brigades of firefighters rushed to extinguish the blazing fire.
meanings.sent5: The community brigades came together to support those in need during the crisis.
